quizzes.question: Is it possible to have multiple backgrounds in CSS3?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]CSS3[/h1]

CSS3 is the latest standard for CSS.
CSS3 is completely backwards-compatible with earlier CSS versions.

Some of the most significant new features are:
[b]Border radius[/b] - allows us to create rounded corners for elements.
[b]Border images[/b] - allows us to specify an image as the border around an element.
[b]Multiple backgrounds [/b]- applies multiple backgrounds to elements.
[b]Animations and effects[/b], and much more! 
[note]There are lots of other great features that will be discussed in upcoming lessons.[/note]

quizzes.question: CSS defines two types of gradients: linear and ...
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]CSS3: New Features [/h1] 

To make web development easier and faster, CSS3 introduces additional new features, including the following:

[b]Box Shadow[/b]
With the [b]box-shadow[/b] property, you can attach one or more shadows to an element by specifying values for color, size, blur, and offset.

[b]Gradients [/b]
CSS3 gradients allow us to set the background color of the element to a gradient. Two types of gradients are available: [b]Linear [/b]and [b]Radial[/b].

quizzes.question: Which CSS3 feature allows animation from one CSS property value to another?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]CSS3: New Features [/h1]

[b]Transforms [/b]allow you to [b]rotate[/b], [b]scale[/b], [b]move[/b], and [b]skew [/b]elements. 

Another popular feature is [b]Transitions [/b]which allows you to animate from one CSS property value to another. You can combine it with transforms and animate the element's position, rotation, or scale.

The property attracting the most attention is [b]Animations[/b]. 
CSS Animations have their own specifications, and they allow you to create [b]keyframes[/b], set duration, easing, and more.
[note]Most of the new features have been implemented by major web browsers, so you can already enjoy the power of CSS3.[/note]
